alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 10:01AM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain and rising snow levels over the slopes of the Olympics will continue throughout the day and will push the Skokomish River at Potlatch above moderate flood stage today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM PST Monday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM PST Monday was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet late this afternoon and then fall below flood stage Tuesday night. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 03/19/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 600 PM PST.
